title-part.text: CHEMICAL OR PHYSICAL LABORATORY APPARATUS FOR GENERAL USE

reference.text: apparatus for medical or pharmaceutical purposes A61; apparatus for industrial purposes or laboratory apparatus whose construction and performance are comparable to that of similar industrial apparatus, see the relevant classes for industrial apparatus, particularly subclasses of B01 and C12; separating or distilling apparatus B01D; mixing or stirring devices B01F; atomisers B05B;

CPC-specific-text.text: vibrating devices, e.g. shaking tables,

reference.text: sieves B07B; corks, bungs B65D; handling liquids in general B67; vacuum pumps F04; siphons F04F10/00; taps, stop-cocks F16K; tubes, tube joints F16L; apparatus specially adapted for investigating or analysing materials G01, particularly G01N; electrical or optical apparatus, see the relevant classes in Sections G and H

note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers only laboratory apparatus which is either applicable solely to laboratory purposes or which, by reason of its simple construction and adaptability, is such as would not be suitable for industrial use.

The following IPC groups are not used in the CPC scheme. Subject matter covered by these groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
- B01L3/14 covered by B01L3/50

reference.text: fume cupboards B08B; provided with manipulation devices, glove boxes B25J; cooling chambers F25D

CPC-specific-text.text: Environmental chambers

reference.text: incubators for culturing cells C12M41/14, Test chambers to test weather resistance G01N17/002
clean rooms suitable for industrial purposes F24F3/161

CPC-specific-text.text: for storing hazardous materials in the laboratory, e.g. cupboards, waste containers

title-part.text: Containers or dishes for laboratory use, e.g. laboratory glassware

reference.text: bottles B65D; apparatus for enzymology or microbiology

CPC-specific-text.text: specially adapted for culturing

reference.text: receptacles for volumetric purposes G01F

CPC-specific-text.text: Burettes, i.e. for withdrawing and redistributing liquids through different conduits
of the plunger pump type
Pipettes, i.e. with only one conduit for withdrawing and redistributing liquids
Accessories for glass pipettes; Gun-type pipettes, e.g. safety devices, pumps
of the plunger pump type

reference.text: medical syringes A61M

CPC-specific-text.text: Capillary pipettes, i.e. having very small bore

reference.text: B01L3/0224 to B01L3/0237 take precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: having mechanical means to set stroke length, e.g. movable stops

reference.text: B01L3/0231, B01L3/0234 take precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: Details of motor drive means

reference.text: B01L3/0231, B01L3/0234 take precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: having several coaxial pistons
Repeating pipettes, i.e. for dispensing multiple doses from a single charge
Details of electronic control, e.g. relating to user interface
Drop counters; Drop formers

reference.text: making arrays for combinatorial libraries B01J19/0046; automation of dispensing for analysis G01N35/10

CPC-specific-text.text: using pins
Prongs, quill pen type dispenser
Pin and ring type or pin in tube type dispenser
characterized by the form or material of the pin tip
using stamps
using touch-off at substrate or container
using valves to interrupt or meter fluid flow, e.g. using solenoids or metering valves
using pulse dispensing or spraying, eg. inkjet type, piezo actuated ejection of droplets from capillaries
Dropper bottles
Interchangeable or disposable dispensing tips
co-operating with positive ejection means
mounted within a receptacle

reference.text: wash bottles B01L3/10

CPC-specific-text.text: Ergonomic aspects, e.g. form or arrangement of controls
Apparatus for withdrawing or distributing predetermined quantities of fluid

reference.text: B01L3/02 takes precedence; sample taking G01N1/00; sample taking within automatic analysers G01N35/00; volume measuring in general G01F

CPC-specific-text.text: for liquids
from piercable tubing, e.g. in extracorporeal blood sampling

reference.text: specially adapted for distillation B01D
devices for taking samples of blood A61B5/14
not used, see B01L3/50 and subgroups

note.note-paragraph: This is no longer used for the classification of new documents as from 1 April 2012. The back-file is being transferred to B01L3/50 and subgroups

CPC-specific-text.text: Containers for the purpose of retaining a material to be analysed, e.g. test tubes

reference.text: devices for taking samples of blood A61B5/14

CPC-specific-text.text: with fluid transport, e.g. in multi-compartment structures

reference.text: centrifugal-type cuvettes G01N21/07; analysis by separation into components G01N30/00; automatic analysers G01N35/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Test tubes specially adapted for centrifugation purposes

reference.text: centrifuges B04B5/04

CPC-specific-text.text: using a float to separate phases
with a sample being transported to, and subsequently stored in an absorbent for analysis
for parallel transport of multiple samples
Multi-well filtration
by integrated micro-fluidic structures, i.e. dimensions of channels and chambers are such that surface tension forces are important, e.g. lab-on-a-chip

reference.text: B01L3/5023 takes precedence; micromixers B01F13/0059; microreactors for synthesis B01J19/0093; micro-capillary devices in general B81B1/00

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the manufacture of the container or its components

reference.text: manufacture of micro-structural devices in general B81C; by shaping or joining plastic parts B29C59/00 B29C65/00, by laminating B32B37/00

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by interfacing components, e.g. fluidic, electrical, optical or mechanical interfaces
characterised by venting arrangements
characterised by the means or forces applied to move the fluids

reference.text: micro pumps F04B19/006, of the membrane type F04B43/043

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by integrated valves

reference.text: microvalves F16K99/0001

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the means for controlling flow resistance, e.g. flow controllers, baffles

reference.text: B01L3/502738 takes precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by bulk separation arrangements on lab-on-a-chip devices, e.g. for filtration or centrifugation

reference.text: separation in general B01D; micro-apparatus for analysis using electrophoresis G01N27/44791; sample preparation G01N1/28

CPC-specific-text.text: specially adapted for handling suspended solids or molecules independently from the bulk fluid flow, e.g. for trapping or sorting beads, for physically stretching molecules

reference.text: investigating characteristics of particles G01N15/00

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by multiphase flow arrangements
specially adapted for focusing or laminating flows
specially adapted for droplet or plug flow, e.g. digital micro-fluidics

reference.text: automatic analysis using a stream of discrete samples in a tube system G01N35/08

using swabs
flexible containers not provided for above
Hinged, e.g. opposable surfaces
rigid containers not provided for above
Test tubes per se
Closing or opening means, corks, bungs

reference.text: closures for containers B65D; means for removing stoppers B67B7/02

CPC-specific-text.text: for multiple samples, e.g. micro-titration plates
specially adapted for heating or cooling samples

reference.text: laboratory heating apparatus B01L7/00; incubators C12M

CPC-specific-text.text: with covers or lids
using modular assemblies of strips or of individual wells
using arrays or bundles of open capillaries for holding samples
confining liquids at a location by surface tension, e.g. virtual wells on plates, wires

reference.text: B01L3/50857 takes precedence

for a plurality of reagents

for container closures

title-part.text: Gas collection apparatus, e.g. by bubbling under water

reference.text: for sampling G01N

title-part.text: Gas washing apparatus, e.g. by bubbling

with provision for submitting samples to a predetermined sequence of different temperatures, e.g. for treating nucleic acid samples

CPC-specific-text.text: with physical movement of samples between temperature zones
by moving sample containers
using spatial temperature gradients

CPC-specific-text.text: specially adapted for capillary tubes
Clamping means, tongs

reference.text: in general F16B2/06

CPC-specific-text.text: Supports for flat sample carrier, e.g. used for plates, slides, chips
for multisample carriers, e.g. used for microtitration plates
for microfluidic devices, e.g. used for lab-on-a-chip
Supports related to pipettes and burettes
for disposable pipette tips, e.g. racks or cassettes
for dispensing pins

title-part.text: Subject matter not provided for in other groups of this subclass

reference.text: chemical indicators in general G01N

title-part.text: Solutions for specific problems relating to chemical or physical laboratory apparatus
Adapting objects or devices to another
Adjust spacings in an array of wells, pipettes or holders, format transfer between arrays of different size or geometry
adapted for different sizes of tubes, tips or container
Align devices or objects to ensure defined positions relative to each other
Fluid interfacing between devices or objects, e.g. connectors, inlet details
Exchange or ejection of cartridges, containers or reservoirs
Control of the sequence of chambers filled or emptied
Purification arrangements, e.g. solid phase extraction (SPE)
Focussing flows, e.g. to laminate flows
Filling fluids into wells by specific techniques
Handling flowable solids, e.g. microscopic beads, cells, particles
Sorting or classification of particles or molecules
Stretching or orienting elongated molecules or particles
Handling of plugs of fluid surrounded by immiscible fluid
Venting, avoiding backpressure, avoid gas bubbles
Creating chemical gradients in a fluid
Ergonomic or safety aspects of handling devices
Integrating sample preparation and analysis in single entity, e.g. lab-on-a-chip concept
Process control and prevention of errors
Identification, exchange or storage of information
Sending and receiving of information, e.g. using bluetooth
Storing results with means integrated into the container
Displaying results or values with integrated means
Connecting closures to device or container
whereby the whole cover is slidable
Function or devices integrated in the closure
Holders integrated in container to position an object
Sensor or part of a sensor is integrated
Standardised forms, e.g. compact disc (CD) format
Cards, e.g. flat sample carriers usually with flow in two horizontal directions
Filaments, strings, fibres, i.e. not hollow
Specific forms of parts of containers
Configuration of multiple channels and/or chambers in a single devices
comprising only one inlet and multiple receiving wells, e.g. for separation, splitting
Multiple inlets and one sample wells, e.g. mixing, dilution
having a very large number of wells, microfabricated wells
Means to control humidity and/or other gases
Control and use of surface tension forces, e.g. hydrophobic, hydrophilic
Specific details about hydrophobic, oleophobic surfaces
Specific optical properties, e.g. reflective coatings
Conductive heating, heat from thermostatted solids is conducted to receptacles, e.g. heating plates, blocks
using electrical currents in the sample itself
using phase changes in a medium
Pipettes or dispensers with temperature control
Drop detachment mechanisms of single droplets from nozzles or pins
non contact spotting by inertia, i.e. abrupt deceleration of the nozzle or pin
droplet contacts the surface of the receptacle
touch-off at the side wall of the receptacle
electrostatic forces between substrate and tip
Pin is moved through a ring which is filled with a fluid
Moving fluids with specific forces or mechanical means
acoustic forces, e.g. surface acoustic waves (SAW)
thermal energy, e.g. vaporisation, bubble jet
Chemical or electrochemical formation of bubbles
specific mechanical means and fluid pressure
Travelling waves, e.g. in combination with electrical or acoustic forces
distribution valves, valves having multiple inlets and/or outlets, e.g. metering valves, multi-way valves
Molecular gates forcing or inhibiting diffusion
mechanically breaking a wall or membrane within a channel or chamber
surface tension valves, capillary stop, capillary break
vents used to stop and induce flow, backpressure valves
Regulating or influencing the flow resistance
Active control of flow resistance, e.g. flow controllers
using baffles or other fixed flow obstructions
